intro: Rhynchotechum hispidum, commonly known as the hairy leathery moss, is a member of the family Dicranaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and hairy leaf surfaces. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually elongated and have a distinct midrib, with a thick, leathery texture. Rhynchotechum hispidum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
